entry.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's Oval Office desk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the key to Franklin D. Roosevelt's Oval Office desk (pictured) is missing?

entry.title: Nadjamuddin Daeng Malewa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Nadjamuddin Daeng Malewa was forming a government cabinet for the State of East Indonesia, he was outside the region?

entry.title: Ireland's Eye (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the name of Ireland's Eye off Howth northeast of Dublin has nothing to do with the organ but can actually be translated as "Ireland's island"?

entry.title: Theodore Conrad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Theodore Conrad, who evaded capture for 52 years after stealing US$215,000, remained a fugitive for so long that he was finally tracked down by the son of one of the original investigators?

entry.title: bilateral relations between the two countries (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Burmese and South Korean first ladies held their first informal conversation 44 years after the establishment of bilateral relations between the two countries?

entry.title: Kate DiCamillo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that children's author Kate DiCamillo received 473 rejection letters before her first novel was accepted for publication?

entry.title: Tribhuvan Sadan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the infamous Nepalese royal massacre took place in the Tribhuvan Sadan?

entry.title: Manasoo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the freighter Manasoo is believed to have been sunk by cows?
